name: BEST WESTERN Bisanzio

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Bisanzio. Small clean rooms. Staff was very helpful, Marco especially gave us some great places to go for dinner which really made the trip special. Great location, reasonable price. Overall, a great experience and would stay again.
reviews.title: Great little place!!
excellent
reviews.text: have just arrived back from 4 nights at the Bisanzio.
very smartly decorated, immaculately clean, large room, very nice furnishings and shower room, great shower. very good breakfast and extremely helpfull and friendly staff.
reviews.title: After our Med. cruise, this hotel was perfect!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great situation and would recommend it to anyone, best 3 star hotel I have stayed in.
reviews.title: Great Location
Tiny room, busy staff
reviews.text: One minor complaint but that covers most other hotels. Hard beds!

We stayed for two nights at this well kept hotel that was tucked away from the "traffic" yet only a seven minute walk from St Mark's Square. No main canal views from our window, but the rooms we were in were tidy, clean and quite large for an European hotel. Mind you, three of us were in superior rooms, which were a bit more expensive, but quite reasonable. The fourth room was a standard and was more typically European in size. The washrooms were sparkling clean and well kept. Heated towel racks seem to be a common theme in Italian hotels. A nice complementary breakfast was included with both hot and cold items available. Their coffee could have been better though. The people at the front desk were very helpful and pleasant; Gabriele, in particular, was an outstanding employee. Thanks all for a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: a good little hotel tucked away from traffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: Good Little Hotel

reviews.text: Our room was nothing spectacular, but it had everything we needed and was clean. It also had a nice patio over a courtyard.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service and good breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel.
reviews.title: 5 perfect days in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very easy to find once you leave the water taxi from the airport. We had booked a family room, but were offered a very spacious apartment for the 3 of us. The apartment was a short walk away from the hotel again in an excellent location. The apartment was fully serviced, with a kitchen.
reviews.title: Nice place but compare with other hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff are extremely helpful; they couldn’t do enough for us. Our room was large and very clean as was the bathroom. If you are expecting views of the Grand Canal this isn’t the hotel for you, the views are restricted but it more than makes up for that with its close proximity to St Mark’s Square. The buffet style breakfast was excellent, there was an extensive choice.
reviews.title: The hotel staff are extremely helpful; they couldn’t do enough for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read the reviews on TripAdvisor before we went, and we were not disappointed ! The hotel staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were cosy comfortable and best of all QUIET. Breakfast was plentiful with a good choice.The bathroom was top quality and sparkling clean. Boiling hot shower and bath, which is what you need after walking most of the day ! The Hotel was steps away from the airport vapporetti stop, and St Marks square. Its within walking distance to all the sights.I had forgotten my adapter plug, but the lovely man on reception went out of his way to find me one, nothing was too much trouble. I would without doubt stay here again, we were going to stay in Mestre, but why go to Venice and not stay in this beautiful city.
reviews.title: the hotel and its position were 1st class

reviews.text: The service was excellent, we checked in very late around midnight and the hotel staff was quite accommodating. The rooms were spacious, clean although the furnishings are old it gives the rooms a nice vintage feel.
reviews.title: Great service but not great during winter

reviews.text: The aircon is a joke, and as we were there during winter its a wonder we didnt freeze to death. I would recommend this hotel, but not in winter.
reviews.title: Cozy but small!

reviews.text: Awesome location right next to one of the waterboat stations, and a short walk from St Mark's square.
reviews.title: Friendly, located an easy walk from St Marks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend stay at the Hotel Bisanzio in Venice. The hotel is great and me and my partner had a lovely stay. Firstly the location is brilliant, just off the Grande Canal and literally a 2 minute walk (if that) to St Marks Square and all the other sites. The main Vaporetta stop is directly outside the hotel as are a variety of restaurants and other ammenities.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff we encountered at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and we both felt at home and comfortable in the hotel. Our room was lovely, just the right size for the two of us and we even had a small balcony over looking the rooftops of Venice.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side to the hotel was the breakfast, though it is your standard European fare - cereal, fruit, cold cuts and eggs and some pastry. We had it on our first morning but didn't bother after that (having a healthy Gelatto breakfast instead).
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: All in all I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone travelling to venice. We had a lovely stay and the hotel was everything we could have hoped for.
reviews.title: Beware of Hotel Bisanzio!

reviews.text: The Bisanzio is in a good location for transport to/from the airport or to take a vaporetto to other areas of town. Very close to San Marco Piazza.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, excellent hotel
Beautiful and charming
reviews.text: This is a really cozy and beautiful little hotel. Rooms are small but really charming, as well as the street where the hotel is located. Walking distance to San Pierto and all other major attractions. Great value amongst venetian hotels. Highly highly recommended.

reviews.title: Apartment
reviews.text: We stayed here Sept 20-21st. We used their apartment which is several blocks away. It offered a mini fridge, stovetop and table. We had 5 people which it sleeps, but it is pretty tight quarters. Kitchen/living room(2 chairs) and bunk beds are all in one room with a separate bedroom that sleeps 2. Shower kept up with all 5 of us, didn't run out of hot water. Breakfast was average, free eggs would have been nice instead of charging for them. Marco at the front desk was very friendly and helpful.

The Bisanzio is reasonably nice and extremely well-located, but the breakfasts were grim. The food was terrible, lacklustre (verging on stale) croissants and rolls, only the coffee was worth having. Also, our room was hot, and the air conditioning didn't seem to work, but when I queried this at Reception they said that it had been turned off for the winter. Neither a fan nor an alternative room was offered. Unfortunately, there was a mosquito in the room, and we got bitten a lot! We had several good meals using the Time Out guide, but we asked the hotel for a recommendation for our last night. Big mistake. They recommended a place called the Giardinetto, where they claimed that the Venetians went .... Ha. We were shown to a table outside in the garden, which was freezing cold, and where the customers were all tourists wearing their coats and not complaining. When I asked to be moved inside, they asked if we had a reservation (we did and had already said so), and gave us a table at the furthest end of the restaurant next to a door in permanent use. The food was mediocre, the soup tepid, and when the waiter brought the bill he stood over me while I looked at it in some amazement since it was for 96 euros for 2 people! I couldn't tell the receptionist about our experience since he was not on duty before we left, but no one asked once if everything was OK with our room or if we had enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Quite good value but beware restaurant recommendations
Heaven In Venice
reviews.text: Do you want a hotel that is quiet? immaculate? friendly? well located? and IN Venice? I probably shouldnt tell anyone as the hotel will become too popular. The Bisanzio is located a short walk from St Mark's Square and easy to get to from the Alilaguna. The staff are all friendly and helpful. We were there in early September and it is an oasis of calm and respite from the heat (yes air conditioning). We were there four/five years ago and it has not changed but remains really the perfect hotel. My only regret was not being able to take the hotel maid home with me as the rooms are spotless. Ciao!
A great hotel. Front desk staff - Gabrielle and Francesco - were great. Room was very clean. Very close to St. Mark's Square. Excellent choice for a family.
reviews.title: Bisanzio
Nice Hotel-Convenient Location
reviews.text: We stayed at the Best Western Hotel Bisanzio in Venizia for 3 nights in August during our Honeymoon. The hotel is conveniently located about 300 meters from Pizza San Marco which was great! Water bus transport is very very close to Hotel. Water Bus stop is NOT San Marco but rather the next stop which is closer to the Hotel!

This is a great little hotel with an extremely helpful staff and wonderful location. It is literally a 3-5 minute walk to St Mark's Square. When we checked in we were asked if we wanted a little more room - they have apts approx 1500 metres away. We checked them out and decided to go with the hotel rooms, I would recommend the hotel rooms vs the apts, they are a little out of the way and extremely dark and we found it more convenient to be in the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Great hotel, wonderful location

reviews.text: This hotel is great value for money. It's fairly small and very well run. The rooms are very clean and nicely furnished/equipped .. excellent shower! Our room had a lovely outdoor terrace, perfect for warm afternoons and evenings with nice roof top views. Unfortunately, it was -4 degrees when we visited, so not much use.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: Breakfast was a lot better than any of the others I have experienced in Italy .. juice, cereals, rolls, croissants, ham, cheese, yoghurts, fruit, various spreads and lovely coffee or tea.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Location is good, just off the waterfront and only a couple of bridges away from St Marks's Square.
reviews.title: Great Location and Wonderful Service

reviews.text: I would recommend this for a good value break.
reviews.title: Not Bad But Not The Best Either
Excellent Choice in Venice
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Not only a great location, but a gem of a hotel with exceptionally friendly staff, great breakfast, good size rooms for a European hotel, sizeable modern bath and a cute little terrace to enjoy the breezes. Just off a main thorofare'it is quietly welcoming. A short stroll from the San Zaccharia vaporetto stop and St.Mark's Square, We can.'t wait to go back.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Venice

reviews.text: Located near the San Marco.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a small alley. Easy to locate compared to the other hotel located inside the Venice Maze.
reviews.title: Eight perfect days and nights - would rate it even higher if I could!

reviews.text: Nice room. Nice breakfast
reviews.title: Great location, excellent service & good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Taxi Boat to Marco Polo Airport located right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: My lovely wife and two beautiful daughters, ages 25 and 21, and I met for 4 glorious days at the Hotel Bisanzio in mid-August. Our very quiet family suite was new and impeccably clean, the daily maid service of the highest quality, and the room well-appointed and spacious. We had two floors overlooking a small drawing room, replete with TV having American and British news channels and programming, along with Italian stations. Our room was as comfortably air-conditioned as we desired, even on days when the temperature was in the 90's F. The upstairs shower stream was strong and the water hot, a mini-fridge well-stocked with juices, water, soda, wine and local libations, as well as snack foods. The downstairs bath was quite large, and the hotel stocked all the usual amenities one would expect at a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Marvelous Hotel, People, Location

reviews.text: The hotel staff were all simply fabulous, taking great pleasure in answering our questions and directing us to proper vaporetto lines, shopping areas and restaurants of their recommendation, and others of our predetermined choice. Tony was especially "simpatico," twinkling his eyes and smiling often, making jokes and doing everything he could to make our stay pleasant. As an example, our three separate flights from Amsterdam, London and Athens were each delayed on arrival. At 7:30 PM after we each had arrived, he called an hour before we wanted to have dinner at a highly sought after restaurant recommended in the Frommer's guide, Trattoria di Remigio (where normally you must book reservations well in advance). He spoke directly with the maitre'de, asking him to please try to squeeze us in as a favor to the Hotel. We dined graciously one and a half hours later at 9 PM. And this on a Friday evening as well.
reviews.title: Great location and rooms
great find, easy to find
reviews.text: On another occasion I was given superb directions to the UNESCO office, and later, after an unfortunate reaction to seppia (cuttlefish), I was given very specific directions to the Ospitale Civile (well worth visiting next to the fantastic Chiesa di San Giovanni and Paolo and piazza, by the way), where, after communicating in French to the doctore, I was placed on an IV and treated for an allergic reaction. The hotel staff also checked to see if I had arrived OK, and later relayed messages from the doctore who called to check on me after my discharge. Tony translated the doses on my script for medication, and translated what the doctore had said re followup care.

reviews.title: Wonderful Venice
reviews.text: The location of the Bisanzio is perfect, adjacent to the Hotel Metropole, literally a stroll over two bridges on the Riva degli Schiavone for ten minutes to Piazza San Marco. It is adjacent to the church where Vivaldi composed many of his masterpieces.

Our rate was very well-priced for Venice at 210 Euros per night, the breakfast a cut above the traditionally well-prepared continental fare, with an option for cooked eggs to order for a modest charge if we desired. The juices and coffee were excellent, and everything on the menu in unlimited quantities in a beautiful room decorated with blue stained glass. The photos on the website, while faithful, really don't do this spectacular hotel justice when in person. The Bisanzio truly is worthy of 4 stars, and we can't imagine a better stay and hope to return again soon.
reviews.title: one of the nicest places

reviews.text: Booked this hotel via the AirMiles website.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again
Would stay here again
reviews.text: Great location just a minute's walk from the main canal front yet nice and quiet location. Only 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco and just two minutes from Vaporetto stop. Also found a decent restaurant just a couple of minute's walk away.

One of the absolutely finest hotels in Venezia. I am in Venezia on a regular basis and never even consider any place else. Location is terrific. It is a quiet and restful haven near by but away from the hubub of San Marco
reviews.title: Very nice - great location!

description: In the heart of Venice, in a location that is extremely quiet but close to all the principal attractions of the city, the Hotel Bisanzio occupies an ancient 16th-century palazzo that was once the home and “workshop” of Alessandro Vittoria, one of the most important Venetian sculptors of the 16th century and a student of the great Jacopo Sansovino. A recent, careful restoration has allowed the Hotel Bisanzio to preserve the fascination of an ancient Venetian palazzo that is, today, equipped with every modern amenity, to ensure a relaxing stay in a structure equipped with elevator, air-conditioning, LCD TV and Wi-Fi Internet access. Ease of access is not secondary when talking about Venice, where people almost always get around on foot. The Hotel Bisanzio is perfectly located, just 150 meters from the city's main public transportation stop (San Marco - Zaccaria), where all the lines for the other areas of the city and the adjacent islands arrive and depart.
